description: Khmers are a versatile civilization that can excel in various strategies, including infantry, siege, and elephants.
dark_age: Start with 4 villagers and a scout.
Build 2 houses, a lumber camp, and a mining camp.
Train additional villagers from the town center.
Build a barracks and train 3-4 militia.
Use the scout to explore the map and find resources.
Advance to Feudal Age at around 21-22 minutes with 500 food and 200 gold.
Have around 800-1000 food, 200-300 wood, 150-200 gold, and 50-100 stone at the end of the Dark Age.
Assign 4-5 villagers to food, 2-3 to wood, 1-2 to gold, 1-2 to stone, and keep 1 or 2 villagers as idle for emergency situations.
feudal_age: Build additional barracks and continue producing infantry units.
Build a blacksmith and a market to upgrade units and sell excess resources for gold.
Build a stable and start producing scouts and/or knights.
Advance to Castle Age at around 28-29 minutes with 800 food and 400 gold.
Have around 1500-2000 food, 800-1000 wood, 500-600 gold, and 200-300 stone at the end of the Feudal Age.
Assign 8-10 villagers to food, 5-6 to wood, 3-4 to gold, 2-3 to stone, and keep 1 or 2 villagers as idle for emergency situations.
castle_age: Build a siege workshop and start producing siege units.
Build a monastery and start training monks.
Research the unique technology, Tusk Swords, for improved battle elephant performance.
Advance to Imperial Age at around 35-36 minutes with 1000 food, 1000 gold, and 800 stone.
Have around 3500-4000 food, 2000-2500 wood, 1200-1500 gold, and 1200-1500 stone at the end of the Castle Age.
Assign 20-25 villagers to food, 10-12 to wood, 8-10 to gold, 8-10 to stone, and keep 1 or 2 villagers as idle for emergency situations.
imperial_age: Build a castle and start producing ballista elephants.
Research the unique technology, Double Crossbow, for improved scorpion and ballista elephant performance.
Have around 6000-7000 food, 4000-5000 wood, 2500-3000 gold, and 2500-3000 stone in the late Imperial Age.
Assign 40-50 villagers to food, 20-25 to wood, 16-20 to gold, and 16-20 to stone, and keep 1 or 2 villagers as idle for emergency situations.
